resources.string: The ability to send moves over the internet via MQTT is no longer supported on your version of Android.

Please let me know that you’ve seen this warning (via the “%1$s” button below). Very few people are still using this version of Android, and I hoped none of them was using CrossWords for networked play. I can try to work around this problem once I know it actually impacts someone.
Usually this means accepting invitations from the same device
CrossWords is staying awake to check for remote moves. Tap for more information.
Keep CrossWords awake to receive moves, even when it is not visible or the device is asleep. Note: may impact battery life.

For the best experience with networked games, CrossWords tries to remain active in the background checking for incoming moves. This can impact battery life, which is why Android discourages it, and why you will always see a notification when it is happening.
The move checker only runs when a move has been made in at least one networked game in the last %1$d hours. You can configure it, or disable it altogether, using the “%2$s” button below.
The Move Checker is currently running. It will stop in %1$dh%2$02dm unless a move is made or received before then.
The Move Checker is not currently running.
The Move Checker is currently disabled.
If you get tired of seeing the notification you can use your device’s Settings app to hide it. Get there with the button below.
How many hours to stay awake
CrossWords will receive moves from other players more quickly if you enable the new Move Checker feature. The More info button will tell you how.
